Check out this thread about reading ledger data.

This might be a better way in the long run to query information about our rewards, etc.

text: <https://staging-docs.daml.com/tools/daml-shell/index.html>
Basically, you can query ledger data using SQL, very performant... no need to build you own db if you learn how to use this

text:
indeed. Well Aki can use this one if he’d like. But if he wants a place to hack around, it should not be here :slightly_smiling_face: as this one has pagerduty alerts connected.

But he can open PRs! I’ll mention it to him. This one is also built to not hammer the backend too aggressively, so it doesn’t cause outages with our billing system

elements.text: indeed. Well Aki can use this one if he’d like. But if he wants a place to hack around, it should not be here

as this one has pagerduty alerts connected.

But he can open PRs! I’ll mention it to him. This one is also built to not hammer the backend too aggressively, so it doesn’t cause outages with our billing system

text:
<@U05FZBDQ4RJ> actually i can just mention you here. You can see a canton rewards dashboard on our <https://status.dlc.link> page now, This will shows less data than yours, and it refreshes itself every 5 minutes, and will trigger pagerduty if rewards drop below 5000 in two successive rounds.

I would say you can feel free to keep your app so you can tweak it in interesting ways that you want to learn about.

But if you want to merge them, you can open PRs against this one :slightly_smiling_face:!

elements.text: actually i can just mention you here. You can see a canton rewards dashboard on our

page now, This will shows less data than yours, and it refreshes itself every 5 minutes, and will trigger pagerduty if rewards drop below 5000 in two successive rounds.

I would say you can feel free to keep your app so you can tweak it in interesting ways that you want to learn about.

But if you want to merge them, you can open PRs against this one

text: Hey <@U088UV6MKFE> is the Canton backup process something that you would need to do daily or can we do it once and always recover back to the most recent state from the one backup? Also where is the file stored and how big is it thanks

elements.text: Hey

is the Canton backup process something that you would need to do daily or can we do it once and always recover back to the most recent state from the one backup? Also where is the file stored and how big is it thanks

text:
They are identity dumps, so they store the keys for the parties on the node. So you only need to do a new one, if you set up new parties on the node.

They are stored as Kubernetes Secrets on the cluster

elements.text:
They are identity dumps, so they store the keys for the parties on the node. So you only need to do a new one, if you set up new parties on the node.

They are stored as Kubernetes Secrets on the cluster

text:
On the other hand I figured out why the charts are increasing. We did not filter for successful transfers. All the amounts have been included. The fee calculation calculates based on the last tansfer, so if one client keeps failing the amount will always be higher. Since we didn't filter them out it make sense it increases.

On the other hand we talked with <@U088UV6MKFE>, that we should have a limit if someone funds an unfunded client te maximum what we charge is 1 hour instead of the ~3 day.

elements.text:
On the other hand I figured out why the charts are increasing. We did not filter for successful transfers. All the amounts have been included. The fee calculation calculates based on the last tansfer, so if one client keeps failing the amount will always be higher. Since we didn't filter them out it make sense it increases.

On the other hand we talked with
, that we should have a limit if someone funds an unfunded client te maximum what we charge is 1 hour instead of the ~3 day.

text: When looking at this with <@U088UV6MKFE> we found that my 1 minute window for aggregating reward transfers in the same round wasn't long enough. Sometimes the transfers came closer to 2 minutes apart. So I increased that window and it looks better now

we found that my 1 minute window for aggregating reward transfers in the same round wasn't long enough. Sometimes the transfers came closer to 2 minutes apart. So I increased that window and it looks better now

text: Okay, Kubernetes just restarted the ibtc-mainnet, so it heals itself right now. We lost only one cycle because the ibtc-mainnet became irresponsible, but the next cycle just went through properly. I exported the logs and ask cursor about, here is the report.

elements.text: Okay, Kubernetes just restarted the ibtc-mainnet, so it heals itself right now. We lost only one cycle because the ibtc-mainnet became irresponsible, but the next cycle just went through properly. I exported the logs and ask cursor about, here is the report.
